alert.note: Alert for Snohomish (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 28 at 5:49PM PST until March 01 at 10:12PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Seattle WA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Washington... Stillaguamish River At Arlington affecting Snohomish County. .Heavy rain in the Central Cascades will come to an end early Tuesday morning. Precipitation amounts in the 24 hours ending at 5 pm Monday were in the 3 to 5 inch range. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Stillaguamish River At Arlington. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, the Stillaguamish River will cause minor flooding mainly in the Silvana area...including over Pioneer Highway and along Norman Rd. A stage of 16 feet on the Stillaguamish River corresponds roughly to Phase 2 in the Snohomish County Flood program. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:40 PM PST Monday the stage was 12.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 16.5 feet late tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by late tonight at 145 AM PST.
